intro: Phymosia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has bipinnate leaves, which are divided into small, narrow leaflets, and it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. Phymosia cuspidata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty and windy conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
